methods.name: query
methods.description:
Retrieves configuration items by way of a query. All parameters are
 optional.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: the type of the CI

parameters.name: parent
parameters.comment: the parent ID of the CI. If set, only the direct children of this CI are searched.

parameters.name: ancestor
parameters.comment: the ancestor ID of the CI. If set, only the subtree of this CI is searched.

parameters.name: namePattern
parameters.comment:
a search pattern for the name. This is like the SQL "LIKE"
            pattern: the character '%' represents any string of zero or
            more characters, and the character '_' (underscore) represents
            any single character. Any literal use of these two characters
            must be escaped with a backslash ('\'). Consequently, any
            literal instance of a backslash must also be escaped,
            resulting in a double backslash ('\\').

parameters.name: lastModifiedBefore
parameters.comment: look for CIs modified before this date.

parameters.name: lastModifiedAfter
parameters.comment: look for CIs modified after this date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.comment: the desired page, in case of a paged query.

parameters.name: resultPerPage
parameters.comment: the page size, or {@code -1} for no paging.

methods.returnDescription: a list of references to CIs

parameters.name: lastModifiedBefore

name: com.xebialabs.deployit.engine.api.DeploymentService

methods.name: isDeployed
methods.description:
Returns whether or not a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version} of the
 {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Application} that is passed in is already deployed to the
 {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment}.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Application udm.Application}.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment udm.Environment}.

methods.returnDescription: true if there exists a deployed version of the application on the environment, false otherwise.

methods.name: prepareInitial
methods.description: Prepares an initial deployment.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version udm.Version} that is the source of the deployment.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment udm.Environment} that is the target of the deployment.

methods.returnDescription: A new Deployment object to which you can add deployeds.

methods.name: prepareUpdate
methods.description: Prepares an update deployment.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.comment: The ID of the new {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version udm.Version} that is the source of the deployment.

parameters.name: deployedApplicationId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeployedApplication udm.DeployedApplication} that is to be updated.

methods.returnDescription: A new Deployment object which contains the updated deployeds.

methods.name: prepareUndeploy
methods.description: Prepares an undeployment.

parameters.name: deployedApplicationId
parameters.comment: The ID of the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeployedApplication udm.DeployedApplication} that is to be undeployed.

methods.returnDescription: A new Deployment object which contains no deployeds (ie. all deployeds of the previous deployment will be deleted).

methods.name: prepareAutoDeployeds
methods.description:
Prepares all the deployeds for the given deployment.

 This will keep any previous deployeds present in the deployment object that are already present, unless they cannot be deployed with regards to their tags.
 It will add all the deployeds that are still missing.
 <p/>
 Also filters out the deployeds that do not have any source attached anymore (deployables that were previously present).
 <p/>

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The prepared Deployment parameter object

methods.returnDescription: An updated Deployment parameter object.

methods.name: generateSelectedDeployeds
methods.description:
Generates only the deployeds for the given deployables in the deployment.
 <p/>
 Try to generate deployeds from each of the deployables to all the matching {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container}
 in the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment} of the Deployment parameter object.
 <p/>

parameters.name: deployableIds
parameters.comment: The list of IDs of deployables to generate the deployeds for.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The prepared Deployment parameter object

methods.returnDescription: An updated Deployment parameter object.

methods.name: generateSelectedDeployeds
methods.description:
Generates only the deployeds for the given deployables in the deployment.

Try to generate deployeds from each of the deployables to all the matching {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container} in the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment} of the Deployment parameter object.

This request is same as /deployment/generate/selected but does not use URL query parameters avoiding it becoming too long.

parameters.name: selectedDeployment
parameters.comment: The prepared Deployment parameter object with list of IDs of deployables to generate the deployeds for.

methods.returnDescription: An updated Deployment parameter object.

methods.name: generateSingleDeployed
methods.description:
Generates a deployed for the given deployable to the given container in the deployment.
 <p/>
 The deployed should be of the given type (which is optional)
 <p/>

parameters.name: deployableId
parameters.comment: The ID of the deployable to generate a deployed for

parameters.name: containerId
parameters.comment: The ID of the container to generate a deployed to

parameters.name: deployedType
parameters.comment: (Optional) The type of the deployed to generate

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The prepared Deployment parameter object

methods.returnDescription: An updated Deployment parameter object.

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
Validates the generated deployment.

Checks whether all the deployeds that are in the deployment are valid.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The deployment to validate.

methods.returnDescription: The validated deployment.

methods.name: taskPreviewBlock
methods.description: Calculate the plan that XL Deploy will execute for the given deployment. A plan consists of one or more nested blocks. Blocks can be sequential, parallel, or a block containing steps. Note: The block returned is not a task yet, and as such can not be skipped or re-ordered.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The deployment to generate the block for.

methods.returnDescription: The block.

methods.name: taskPreviewBlock
methods.description: Get details on a step in a step block.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The deployment to generate the block for.

parameters.name: blockId
parameters.comment: The id of the step block to query the steps for.

parameters.name: stepNr
parameters.comment: The number of the step to retrieve.

methods.returnDescription: The step.

methods.name: createTask
methods.description: Creates the deployment task.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.comment: The fully prepared Deployment parameter object.

methods.returnDescription: a reference to a Task ID that can be executed by the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.engine.api.TaskService}.

methods.name: rollback
methods.description:
Rollback a {@code STOPPED} or {@code EXECUTED} task. Reverting the deployment to the previous state. The task
 will be set to {@code CANCELLED} when it was {@code STOPPED}, and {@code DONE} when it was {@code EXECUTED}.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.comment: the ID of the task

methods.returnDescription: the ID of the new task.

methods.name: effectiveDictionary
methods.description:
Get the effective dictionary for an environment, optionally filtered by application and container.

 This will return the dictionary that is used when deploying to a specific environment. If an application/applicationVersion is passed, the dictionary is filtered to apply only to deployments of that application.
 If a container is passed, the dictionary is filtered to apply only to deployeds pointing to that container in the environment.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.comment: The ID of the environment

parameters.name: applicationVersion
parameters.comment: The ID of the applicationVersion (package) (optional, can be null)

parameters.name: application
parameters.comment: The ID of the application (optional, can be null). This parameter will be ignored if the applicationVersion is provided.

parameters.name: container
parameters.comment: The ID of the container (optional, can be null)

methods.returnDescription: the entries of the dictionary as it applies to a deployment to that environment

description: Deployment management

description:
XL Deploy supports a role-based access control scheme to ensure the security of your middleware and deployments.
 The security mechanism is based on the concepts of roles and permissions. A (security) role is a group of entities
 that can be authenticated and that can be assigned permissions over resources in XL Deploy. These rights can be either
 global (that is, they apply to all of XL Deploy, such as login permission) or relevant for a particular CI or set
 of CIs (for instance, the permission to read certain CIs in the repository).

 The security system uses the same permissions whether the system is accessed via the GUI or the CLI.

The parameter object for certain REST API and it represents both the artifact CI and its data.
 <p/>
 Artifacts are uploaded to the XL Deploy Server as a multipart HTTP request.
 It consists of the following parts:
 <dl>
 <dt>configurationItem</dt>
 <dd>The property data of the artifact in XML. See {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.artifact.Artifact} for details.</dd>
 <dd>Content-type: application/xml</dd>
 <p/>
 <dt>filename</dt>
 <dd>The file name of the uploaded artifact.</dd>
 <dd>Content-type: application/xml</dd>
 <p/>
 <dt>fileData</dt>
 <dd>The artifact data.</dd>
 <dd>Content-type: application/octet-stream</dd>
 </dl>
